Clamp the catheter, cleanse the port, and use a sterile syringe to remove urine.

question.questiontext: Identify the correct sequence of procedure for urinary catheterization

Drape patient, provide position, clean from inside out, inflate distal balloon, attach and secure

question.questiontext: Why should a catheter drainage bag be kept below the level of the bladder?

option.optiontext: It prevents urine from flowing back into the bladder and causing an infection
The bag is likely to leak if it is held higher than the bladder
The tubing can disconnect from the catheter if it is kept higher than the level of the bladder
The tubing may kink and cause safety hazard to the patient

tag.tagname: kept below the level of the bladder
